title: A grizzly bear kills 2 people in Canada's Banff National Park
description: Authorities received a GPS alert of a bear attack, and once on the scene, found two deceased individuals and an aggressive bear.

title: 'The military has no role' in politics, says retiring chair of the Joint Chiefs
description: The nation's most senior military officer has retired. He talks to All Things Considered about Donald Trump, democracy, and whether the U.S. military has been politicized.

title: Worry and concern follow pro-Kremlin candidate's victory in Slovakia election
description: Former prime minister Robert Fico campaigned as a left-wing populist, opposing continued military support for Ukraine and aligning with Russia against the United States.

title: Latest on Ukraine: U.S. aid stumbles and Slovakia elects a pro-Russia leader
description: Catch up on key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Runners at a track meet in India wanted to avoid drug tests — so they ran away
description: Some athletes just didn't show up. One young woman ran her race — and then kept running after crossing the finish line, forcing a doping control officer to run after her, a coach said.

title: The military is turning to microgrids to fight global threats — and global warming
description: The military is among the largest buyers of independent power systems known as microgrids. They make tactical sense; and environmentalists hope they can help the transition from fossil fuels.

title: Looks like we picked the wrong week to quit quoting 'Airplane!'
description: A new book about the 1980's film "Airplane!" from David Zucker, Jim Abrahams & Jerry Zucker, the writing and directing team responsible for one of the most transformative film comedies in history.

title: Up First briefing: McCarthy's job threatened; how a robot could fight climate change
description: Congress averted a government shutdown. Now, Speaker McCarthy must avoid losing his job. And, this stinky seaweed-fighting robot could help fight climate change.

title: Nobel Prize goes to scientists who made mRNA COVID vaccines possible
description: Hungarian-born biochemist Katalin Karikó and American immunologist Drew Weissman found that a chemical change to genetic code called mRNA eliminated a problematic side effect when used in vaccines.

title: Health care has a massive carbon footprint. These doctors are trying to change that
description: Around the country, health care workers continue to grapple with their industry's massive carbon footprint. In Pittsburgh, doctors formed Clinicians for Climate Action to address the problem.

title: Donald Trump's business fraud trial gets underway in New York
description: Former President Donald Trump and three of his children are accused of exaggerating the value of their real estate.

title: 5 years after Khashoggi's murder, advocates say the lack of justice is dangerous
description: Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi was murdered in October 2018. Those involved in his killing have largely avoided consequences, and Saudi Arabia continues to crack down on its dissidents.

title: It's been 5 years since Jamal Khashoggi was murdered by Saudi agents in Turkey
description: NPR's A Martinez talks to Washington Post columnist David Ignatius about the killing of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi, and about how Saudi Arabia has changed — and how it hasn't.

title: Brain cells, interrupted: How some genes may cause autism, epilepsy and schizophrenia
description: Researchers have identified 46 genes that can disrupt a process that is critical to early brain development. The finding could help scientists find new treatments for disorders including autism.

title: It's not just FTX's Sam Bankman-Fried. His parents also face legal trouble
description: FTX's lawyers allege Sam Bankman-Fried's mom and dad helped shape their son's crypto empire and received millions of dollars worth of gifts and benefits from the now-bankrupt company.

title: Surrounded by synths, Alan Palomo is teasing out a new kind of sound
description: For much of his career, Alan Palomo has coaxed sounds from synthesizers and been at the forefront of the chillwave genre. With his fourth album — and his solo debut — he's changing it up.

title: Poland's dangerous eastern border takes center stage in upcoming elections
description: The NATO and EU member borders Belarus, the Russian territory of Kaliningrad and Ukraine — plus a strip of land connecting it to Lithuania. It is an unstable and volatile mix of frontiers.

title: The Hollywood writers strike is over, but the actors strike could drag on. Here's why
description: The actors union, SAG-AFTRA, is hoping to cut as good a deal with the studios as the writers union, WGA, did last week. But the negotiations, starting Monday, could be more complicated.

title: Climate solutions are necessary. So we're dedicating a week to highlighting them
description: When people talk about climate change, you often hear hopelessness. But what if we reframe the conversation? Humans are driving global warming; that means humans can find solutions to turn it around.

title: Supreme Court to consider abortion pills, guns, social media in its new term
description: In one form or another, all those questions are back on the table this term — mainly to take a second look at appeals from the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals, which covers Texas and parts the South.

title: Monday's Powerball jackpot is now worth more than $1 billion
description: The jackpot for the next drawing Monday night remains the world's ninth-largest lottery prize of all time.

title: At least 9 dead after church roof collapses in Mexico, officials say
description: The Tamaulipas state police said about 100 people were in the church during a Mass at the time of the Sunday collapse.
